block.p: Kathleen Maura Busch, a college administrator, and Ethan Craig Luce, a radar engineer, were married on Cape Cod yesterday. Msgr. Aloysius J. Busch, an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans, Mass.

Mrs. Luce, 30, is the assistant dean for resource development and external relations at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's School of Architecture and Planning. She graduated from the University of Virginia and received a master's degree in education from Harvard. She is a daughter of Nancy and Richard Busch of Morris Township, N.J. Her father is a lawyer in Morristown, N.J., and her mother is a social worker at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N.J.

Kathleen Maura Busch, a college administrator, and Ethan Craig Luce, a radar engineer, were married on Cape Cod yesterday. Msgr. Aloysius J. Busch, an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans, Mass.

Mrs. Luce, 30, is the assistant dean for resource development and external relations at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's School of Architecture and Planning. She graduated from the University of Virginia and received a master's degree in education from Harvard. She is a daughter of Nancy and Richard Busch of Morris Township, N.J. Her father is a lawyer in Morristown, N.J., and her mother is a social worker at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N.J.

Mr. Luce, 43, is a principal engineer with the Raytheon Company, the weapons and aerospace equipment manufacturer, in Tewksbury, Mass. He graduated from Worcester Polytechnic Institute and received master's degrees in mechanical and electrical engineering from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He is the son of Shirley Kurth Luce of East Glenville, N.Y., and Robert G. Luce of Lebanon, N.H. His father, a retired nuclear physicist, worked at the Knolls Atomic Power Laboratory in Niskayuna, N.Y.
